Description: Bowl and lid. Engraved with medallions and arabesques. Inlaid with silver on ground of scroll-work. Made of brass.
Curator's comments: On the origin of this type of metalware: D. Behrens-Abouseif, "Veneto-Saracenic Metalware, a Mamluk Art", Mamluk Studies Review 9 (2005) 147-172.
Bibliographic references: Auld 2004 / Renaissance Venice, Islam and Mahmud the Kurd - a metalworking enigma (pp.148-149)
La Niece, Ward et al 1995 / Veneto-Saracenic metalwork: an analysis of the bowls and incense burners in the British Museum
Acquisition name: Donated by: Sir Augustus Wollaston Franks
